title: UNICEF says aid convoy for 180,000 Syrians could go on Sunday
text: March 2, 2018 / 9:30 AM / Updated 17 minutes ago UNICEF says aid convoy for 180,000 Syrians could go on Sunday Reuters Staff 1 Min Read GENEVA (Reuters) - Syria’s government may allow an aid convoy with supplies for 180,000 people to go to the town of Douma in the besieged enclave of eastern Ghouta on Sunday, the Middle East director of the U.N. children’s agency UNICEF said on Friday. Men sit in a damaged truck in the besieged town of Douma in eastern Ghouta in Damascus, Syria, March 1, 2018. REUTERS/Bassam Khabieh Geert Cappelaere told a news conference in Geneva that there was no sign of agreement on further convoys to serve the rest of the enclave’s 400,000 people, nor any agreement on evacuation for some 1,000 people in dire medical need. Reporting by Tom Miles; Editing by Kevin Liffey
